meanings.definition: To send (something) to the wrong recipient.
meanings.sent1: I missend the invitation to the party to my neighbor instead of my friend.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally missend the important email to her colleague.
meanings.sent3: The cat missend the mouse toy to the dog, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: The wind can sometimes missend the leaves to unexpected places.
meanings.sent5: The postman's sleepy mind caused him to missend the package to the wrong address.

meanings.definition: A letter or package that has been sent to the wrong recipient.
meanings.sent1: The missend ended up at the old house instead of the new one.
meanings.sent2: Receiving a missend can be quite inconvenient for the intended recipient.
meanings.sent3: The missend postcard brought unexpected joy to the wrong person.
meanings.sent4: The missend package felt lost in the sea of wrongly delivered items.
meanings.sent5: The missend letter traveled far before finding its way back to the sender.
